name: Nitroglycerin
indications: Acute decompensated heart failure (ADHF) [cardiogenic pulmonary edema]
Chest pain/discomfort related to cardiac ischemia
contraindications: Recent use of a phosphodiesterase type 5 inhibitor (sildenafil [Viagra, Revatio] or vardenafil [Levitra] with 24 hours or tadalafil [Cialis, Adcirca]) within 36 hours
Tachycardia (HR>100) in the absence of heart failure
side_effects: Methmemoglobinemia (nitrate ions can oxidize hemoglobin to methmemoglobin [this is a long term effect and unlikely to be seen in the EMS setting)

adult: [AC4] [AC5] {Nitro Paste} - SBP > 100 1 inch - SBP > 150 1.5 inch - SBP > 200 2 inch

pearls: Patients with right ventricular infarction (RVI) are very preload sensitive and can develop severe hypotension in response to nitrates or other preload-reducing agents. If hypotension develops following the administration of NTG, an IV fluid bolus may be necessary. In patients with inferior wall STEMI, also obtain right sided leads to assess for evidence of RVI
If patient has taken nitroglycerin without relief, consider potency of the medication.
